definition: Pervez Musharraf (1943-), Pakistani general and politician, president 2001-2008
solemn/reverent/calm/burial position in an ancestral tomb (old)/old variant of 默
surname Mu
granule/hoarse/raspy/sand/powder/CL:粒[li4]/abbr. for Tsar or Tsarist Russia
surname Sha
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
husband/man/manual worker/conscripted laborer (old)

sentences.english: They are supporting just one leader, General Pervez Musharraf.
sentences.chinese: 它只支持一個領導人，那就是穆沙拉夫將軍。

sentences.english: First, though, Mr Musharraf should go.
sentences.chinese: 但是，穆沙拉夫應該離任。

sentences.english: The opposition has accused pro-Musharraf forces of trying to manipulate the election's outcome.
sentences.chinese: 反對派譴責支持穆沙拉夫的軍隊試圖操控選舉結果。

sentences.english: Mr. Musharraf's party is in third with 38 seats.
sentences.chinese: 穆沙拉夫的黨派名列第三，獲得38個議席。

sentences.english: And I'll bet that is what Mubarak now thinks.
sentences.chinese: 而且，我敢打賭這正是穆沙拉夫現在想到的。

sentences.english: I fully agree with President Musharraf's comments on bilateral ties.
sentences.chinese: 我完全同意穆沙拉夫總統對兩國關係的評價。

sentences.english: President Musharaff maintains that the government is not involved in the disappearance of people.
sentences.chinese: 穆沙拉夫堅持說，巴基斯坦政府跟失蹤事件沒有關聯。

sentences.english: Musharraf said that both countries share very sound relations.
sentences.chinese: 穆沙拉夫說，巴中兩國之間有着非常良好的關係。

sentences.english: I do not want Musharraf, President Musharraf, to be president.
sentences.chinese: 我不想讓穆沙拉夫總統繼續擔任總統。

sentences.english: Mr. Musharraf has been a staunch ally of Washington in the global anti-terrorism campaign.
sentences.chinese: 穆沙拉夫是華盛頓全球反恐戰爭的堅定盟友。

sentences.english: Musharraf has been a staunch ally of Washington in the global anti-terrorism campaign.
sentences.chinese: 穆沙拉夫是華盛頓全球反恐戰爭的堅定盟友。

sentences.english: This is just what Mr Musharraf does not have.
sentences.chinese: 而這些都是穆沙拉夫所不具備的。

definition: Bashir (name)/Omar Hassan Ahmad al-Bashir (1944-), Sudanese military man and politician, president of Sudan from 1993
Mahmoud Ahmadinejad (1956-), Iranian fundamentalist politician, president of Iran 2005-2013/abbr. for 艾哈邁迪內賈德|艾哈迈迪内贾德
Anwar Al Sadat
Khamenei, Ayatollah Aly (1939-), Supreme Leader of Iran, aka Ali Khamenei
Maliki or Al-Maliki (name)/Nouri Kamel al-Maliki (1950-) prime minister of Iraq from 2006
Hamid Karzai (1957-), Afghan politician, president 2004-2014
Erdogan (name)/Recep Tayyip Erdoğan (1954-), Turkish politician, prime minister from 2003
Robert Mugabe (1924-), Zimbabwean ZANU-PF politician, president of Zimbabwe 1987-2017
Benazir Bhutto (1953-2007), Pakistani politician, daughter of executed former prime minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto and herself prime minister 1993-1996
Modi (name)/Narendra Modi (1950-), Indian BJP (Bharatiya Janata Party or Indian People's Party) politician, Gujarat Chief Minister from 2001, PM from 2014
Assad (Arabic name)
Mohammed Abdel Rahman Abdel Raouf Arafat al-Qudwa al-Husseini (1929-2004), Palestinian leader, popularly known as Yasser Arafat 亞西爾·阿拉法特|亚西尔·阿拉法特[Ya4 xi1 er3 · A1 la1 fa3 te4]
Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani
Aung San Suu Kyi (1945-), Myanmar opposition leader and 1991 Nobel Peace laureate/also written 昂山素姬
Asif Ali Zardari (1956-), Pakistani People's Party politician, widower of murdered Benazir Bhutto, president of Pakistan from 2008-2013
Yeltsin (name)/Boris Yeltsin (1931-2007) first post-communist president of Russia 1991-1999
